document:
CREATE TABLE mydb.public.orders (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, -- Unique ID for each order
    customer_id INTEGER NOT NULL REFERENCES customers, -- ID of customer who made order
    product_id  INTEGER NOT NULL REFERENCES products, -- ID of product ordered
    order_date  TIMESTAMP NOT NULL, -- Date of order
    quantity    INTEGER NOT NULL, -- Quantity of product ordered
    status      ORDERSTATUS NOT NULL -- Order status ('PENDING', 'SHIPPED', 'DELIVERED', 'CANCELLED') 
);
-- customers.id can be joined with orders.customer_id
-- products.id can be joined with orders.product_id
CREATE TYPE ORDERSTATUS AS ENUM ('PENDING', 'SHIPPED', 'DELIVERED', 'CANCELLED');

CREATE TABLE mydb.public.customers (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, -- Unique ID for each customer
    name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL, -- Name of the customer
    email VARCHAR(150) NOT NULL UNIQUE, -- Email of the customer
    registration_date TIMESTAMP NOT NULL -- Registration date of the customer
);
-- customers.id can be joined with orders.customer_id

CREATE TABLE products (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, -- Unique ID for each product
    name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL, -- Name of the product
    category VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL, -- Category of the product
    price DOUBLE PRECISION NOT NULL -- Price of each unit of the product
);
-- products.id can be joined with orders.product_id
